means: （特别表示因成功而）处于有利地位

sentence.Network_en: I thought they were laughing at me because I was ugly.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得他们嘲笑我是因为我长得丑。

sentence.Network_en: He carried on telling a joke, laughing his head off.
sentence.Network_cn: 他继续讲笑话，自己笑得前仰后合。

sentence.Network_en: He was still laughing when he heard the rasp of Rennie's voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他听到伦尼尖叫的声音时仍然在笑.

entry.def: When you laugh, you make a sound with your throat while smiling and show that you are happy or amused. People also sometimes laugh when they feel nervous or are being unfriendly.

example.ex: He was about to offer an explanation, but she was beginning to laugh...
example.tran: 他正要解释，她却笑起来了。

example.ex: He laughed with pleasure when people said he looked like his dad...
example.tran: 人们说他长得像父亲时，他乐得大笑起来。

entry.def: If people laugh at someone or something, they mock them or make jokes about them.

example.ex: I thought they were laughing at me because I was ugly...
example.tran: 我觉得他们嘲笑我是因为我长得丑。

example.ex: She wanted to laugh at the melodramatic way he was acting.
example.tran: 他戏剧化的夸张架势使她忍不住想笑。

entry.def: If you do something for a  laugh or for laughs, you do it as a joke or for fun.

example.ex: They were persuaded onstage for a laugh by their mates...
example.tran: 他们被同伴们说服，上台一乐。

example.ex: It's a project she's  doing for laughs.
example.tran: 这个项目是她图好玩儿才做的。

entry.def: If a person or their comment gets a laugh or raises a laugh, they make the people listening to them laugh.

example.ex: If you can get a laugh by wearing a silly hat, you must have been born a comic...
example.tran: 如果你戴一顶傻傻的帽子就能让人发笑，那你一定是天生的笑匠。

example.ex: The joke got a big laugh, which encouraged me to continue.
example.tran: 我的笑话引来哄堂大笑，这使我深受鼓舞，继续往下讲。

entry.tran: 好玩/ 开心/有点意思
entry.def: If you describe a situation as a laugh ,a good laugh, or a bit of a laugh, you think that it is fun and do not take it too seriously.

example.ex: Working there's great. It's quite a good laugh actually...
example.tran: 在那儿工作挺不错。说实在的，蛮好玩儿的。

example.ex: It was a good laugh there!

entry.def: If you describe someone as a laugh or a good laugh, you like them because they are amusing and fun to be with.

example.ex: Mickey was a good laugh and great to have in the dressing room.
example.tran: 米基是个活宝，在更衣室里总是逗人笑个不停。

entry.tran: （尤指经历了最初的苦恼不快后）觉得…可笑，对…一笑置之
entry.def: If you have a good laugh about something, you find it amusing and realize that it is funny, especially when the situation was at first upsetting.

example.ex: We've both had a good laugh about the accident despite what's happened.
example.tran: 虽然出了意外，但我俩事后都一笑置之。

entry.tran: 笑到最后；取得最后胜利
entry.def: If you say that you have the last laugh, you mean that you become successful at something so that people who criticize or oppose you look foolish.

example.ex: Des  O'Connor is expecting to have the last laugh on his critics by soaring to the top of the Christmas hit parade.
example.tran: 德斯·奥康纳预计会飙升至圣诞畅销唱片排行榜的榜首，这将让他的批评者都笑不出来。

entry.tran: 别让我笑掉大牙了；别逗了
entry.def: Some people reply to other people's comments or opinions by saying 'Don't make me laugh' when they disagree with them and think they are foolish or inaccurate.

example.ex: Claire, a poisoner? Don't make me laugh — She was just a lousy cook.
example.tran: 克莱尔投毒？别逗了。她只不过厨艺很差罢了。

entry.tran: （对于困境或令人失望的境况）何妨一笑，还有可笑之处
entry.def: If you say 'you've got to laugh' or 'you have to laugh', you are trying to see the amusing side of a difficult or disappointing situation rather than being sad or angry about it.

example.ex: The bikers have shown enough contempt of the law to ride their machines over police cars. 'You've got to laugh at their audacity,' said Mr Starkey.
example.tran: 摩托车党藐视法律，竟对警车玩起凌空飞车来。“牛气可嘉呀，”斯塔基先生说道。

means.word_mean: 1. showing or feeling mirth or pleasure or happiness;

auth_sentence.content: I remember laughing when Oxfam gave me my camels.
auth_sentence.res_content: I remember laughing when Oxfam gave me my camels.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I remember laughing when Oxfam gave me my camels.

auth_sentence.content: The rest of the world is laughing at you.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rest of the world is laughing at you.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rest of the world is laughing at you.

auth_sentence.content: If they are not laughing at they should be.
auth_sentence.res_content: If they are not laughing at they should be.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If they are not laughing at they should be.

sentences.en: The streets were crammed with gay,laughing crowd.
sentences.cn: 街上挤满了欢乐嬉笑的人群。

sentences.en: If you can play like that in tomorrow’s game you’ll be laughing!
sentences.cn: 要是你在明天的比赛中能打出这种水平，那你就没什么可担心的了！

sentences.en: I can’t wear this to the party! I’ll be a laughing stock!
sentences.cn: 我不能穿这个去参加聚会！我会成为笑柄的！

means.word_mean: 决不是开玩笑的事；严肃的事

sentences.en: Trying to find a place to live is no laughing matter.
sentences.cn: 找地方住可不是个开玩笑的事。
